body_html:
Thanks very much for thinking about this @ctava .

However, for now, I'd suggest holding off on this. We've been toying with a common-specification of package organization of generated op wrappers so that generated code in all languages is similar. For example, tf.image.decode_jpeg in Python and image.DecodeJpeg in Go etc.

We're still discussing the details a bit but should hopefully have some notes/code to share within a few weeks. At which time, we'd like to change the Go code generator to use the same configuration file as the code generator for Python and C++ (and others).

(FYI @aselle @josh11b )

We're still discussing the details a bit but should hopefully have some notes/code to share within a few weeks. At which time, we'd like to change the Go code generator to use the same configuration file as the code generator for Python and C++ (and others).

body:
Thanks very much for thinking about this @ctava .

However, for now, I'd suggest holding off on this. We've been toying with a common-specification of package organization of generated op wrappers so that generated code in all languages is similar. For example, `tf.image.decode_jpeg` in Python and `image.DecodeJpeg` in Go etc.

We're still discussing the details a bit but should hopefully have some notes/code to share within a few weeks. At which time, we'd like to change the Go code generator to use the same configuration file as the code generator for Python and C++ (and others).

(FYI @aselle @josh11b )
